Bone knights are the champions of the Order of the Emerald Claw. Clad in distinctive bonecraft armor—heavy armor adorned with the bones of fallen enemies—these fearsome warriors command squads of undead soldiers as they pursue the sinister goals of Lady Illmarrow.

entries.name: Karrnathi Patriots
entries: Early in the Last War, Karrnath turned to the necromancers of the Blood of Vol to bolster the nation's army with undead forces. The skeletons and zombies created by the necromancers were mindless creatures that required guidance. The first bone knights were appointed to provide this control.

Devoted paladins of the Blood of Vol were fused into suits of bonecraft armor, whose magic focused their divine gifts, allowing them to command units of mindless undead. Bonecraft armor can't be removed without killing the knight who wears it, and when donning it, each bone knight understood that their former life was over.

entries.name: The Fall of the Emerald Claw
entries: During the Last War, many bone knights took service with the Order of the Emerald Claw, helping that name strike fear into the enemies of Karrnath. In the last decade, King Kaius III of Karrnath has done much to ensure a peaceful end to the Last War. Under the terms of the Treaty of Thronehold, Kaius sealed most of Karrnath's undead in deep vaults, and the Order of the Emerald Claw was disbanded. A few bone knights remained in service to the crown, but most were cast aside—still bound to their bonecraft armor and still convinced of Karrnathi supremacy. These bone knights felt that Kaius had betrayed both them and their nation, leading their once-proud order to find a new purpose in the service of Lady Illmarrow.

reaction.name: Radiant Damage Absorption. 1/Long Rest

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The wendigo regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the wendigo takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the wendigo's next turn. The wendigo dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

While {@condition poisoned}, the target's Wisdom score is reduced by {@dice 1d4} at the start of each of its turns. This reduction will not cause a target's score to go below 3. When a target's Wisdom reaches a score of 3, it becomes insane and ravenous. While in this state, the creature acts as an ally of the wendigo, gains a bite attack ({@damage 1d6} piercing damage), and must spend its action each turn making a bite attack against an enemy of the wendigo. The Wisdom score reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Baleful Howl
entries: The wendigo emits a terrifying howl. Every enemy within 300 feet of the wendigo that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target that  starts its turn within 30 feet of the wendigo must use all its movement on that turn to get as far from the wendigo as possible, must finish the move before taking an action, and must take the most direct route, even if hazards lie that way. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
A target that successfully saves is immune to the wendigo's baleful howl for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: Uses its claw attack twice against the same target.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: Uses its bite attack

legendary.name: Nimble Movement
entries: Moves up to its movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks

legendary.name: Charge (2 Actions)
entries: Moves up to its movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks and makes a gore attack.

bonus.name: Maddening Whispers
entries: As a bonus action, the wendigo chooses one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, or it takes 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) psychic damage and must use its reaction to move up to half its speed and make a melee weapon attack against one creature of the wendigo's choice that the wendigo can see. Constructs and undead are immune to this effect.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wendigo's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). The wendigo can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the wendigo moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The wendigo has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The wendigo regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the wendigo takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the wendigo's next turn. The wendigo dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the Wendigo fails a save it can choose to succeed instead

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wendigo makes three melee attacks: one with its ravenous bite or gore and two with its claws.

action.name: Ravenous Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. While {@condition poisoned}, the target's Wisdom score is reduced by {@dice 1d4} at the start of each of its turns. This reduction will not cause a target's score to go below 3. When a target's Wisdom reaches a score of 3, it becomes insane and ravenous. While in this state, the creature acts as an ally of the wendigo, gains a bite attack ({@damage 1d6} piercing damage), and must spend its action each turn making a bite attack against an enemy of the wendigo. The Wisdom score reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Baleful Howl
entries: The wendigo emits a terrifying howl. Every enemy within 300 feet of the wendigo that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target that  starts its turn within 30 feet of the wendigo must use all its movement on that turn to get as far from the wendigo as possible, must finish the move before taking an action, and must take the most direct route, even if hazards lie that way. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
A target that successfully saves is immune to the wendigo's baleful howl for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: Uses its claw attack twice against the same target.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: Uses its bite attack

legendary.name: Nimble Movement
entries: Moves up to its movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks

legendary.name: Charge (2 Actions)
entries: Moves up to its movement speed and makes a gore attack.

bonus.name: Maddening Whispers
entries: As a bonus action, the wendigo chooses one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, or it takes 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) psychic damage and must use its reaction to move up to half its speed and make a melee weapon attack against one creature of the wendigo's choice that the wendigo can see. Constructs and undead are immune to this effect.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The goblin makes two attacks with a weapon, or one with a Ballista

action.name: Ballista
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 300 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

Goblins are small, black-hearted, selfish humanoids that lair in caves, abandoned mines, despoiled dungeons, and other dismal settings. Individually weak, goblins gather in large-sometimes overwhelming-numbers. They crave power and regularly abuse whatever authority they obtain.

entries.name: Goblinoids
entries: Goblins belong to a family of creatures called goblinoids. Their larger cousins, hobgoblins and bugbears, like to bully goblins into submission. Goblins are lazy and undisciplined, making them poor servants, laborers, and guards.

entries.name: Malicious Glee
entries: Motivated by greed and malice, goblins can't help but celebrate the few times they have the upper hand. They dance, caper with sheer joy when victory is theirs. Once their revels have ended, goblins delight in the torment of other creatures and embrace all manner of wickedness.

entries.name: Leaders and Followers
entries: Goblins are ruled by the strongest or smartest among them. A goblin boss might command a single lair, while a goblin king or queen (who is nothing more than a glorified goblin boss) rules hundreds of goblins, spread out among multiple lairs to ensure the tribe's survival. Goblin bosses are easily ousted, and many goblin tribes are taken over by hobgoblin warlords or bugbear chiefs.

entries.name: Challenging Lairs
entries: Goblins festoon their lairs with alarms designed to signal the arrival of intruders. Those lairs are also riddled with narrow tunnels and bolt-holes that human-sized creatures can't navigate, but which goblins can crawl through with ease, allowing them to flee or to circle around and surprise their enemies. Rat Keepers and Wolf Riders. Goblins have an affinity for rats and wolves, raising them to serve as companions and mounts, respectively. Like rats, goblins shun sunlight and sleep underground during the day. Like wolves, they are pack hunters, made bolder by their numbers. When they hunt from the backs of wolves, goblins use hit-and-run attacks.

entries.name: Worshipers of Maglubiyet
entries: Maglubiyet the Mighty One, the Lord of Depths and Darkness, is the greater god of goblinoids. Envisioned by most goblins as an eleven-foot-tall battle-scarred goblin with black skin and fire erupting from his eyes, he is worshiped not out of adoration but fear. Goblins believe that when they die in battle, their spirits join the ranks of Maglubiyet's army on the plane of Acheron. This is a "privilege" that most goblins dread, fearing the Mighty One's eternal tyranny even more than death.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Dib uses Command Flanking Maneuver, if available. He then makes two Scimitar attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The goblin can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action asa bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Command Flanking Maneuver {@recharge 5}
entries: The goblin targets up to three allies it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see or hear the goblin, the target can use its reaction to move up to half its speed. The target's next attack has advantage until the start of the goblin's next turn.

reaction.name: Redirect Attack
entries: When a creature the goblin can see targets it with an attack, the goblin chooses another goblin within 5 feet of it. The two goblins swap places, and the chosen goblin becomes the target instead.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The goblin moves up to half its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Intimidate Foe
entries: The goblin targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the goblin, it must make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the goblin until the end of the goblin's next turn.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The goblin makes a melee or ranged attack.

item.name: Cloak of Cleanliness
entries: While wearing this cloak, you are always pristinely clean and well kept, along with having a slight scent of lavender.

item.name: Infinite Grimoire
entries: Your spell book now has an infinite number of pages, is three inches thick, eight inches wide, twelve inches long, and weighs three pounds.

You can use the grimoire as your spellbook, and you can scribe new spells into it as normal. When you prepare wizard spells using the grimoire, the number of wizard spells you can prepare increases by 1.
In the presence of Wizards that show great power, those Wizards may see the grimoire show increased abilities over time.

entries.name: Enhanced
entries: rare (requires attunement by a wizard)
You gain a +1 to your Wizard Spell {@action Attack} rolls and Spell Save DC.
When you use your Arcane Recovery feature you can gain 1 additional level of spells.

entries.name: Empowered
entries: very rare (requires attunement by a wizard)
You gain a +1 to your Wizard Spell {@action Attack} rolls and Spell Save DC.
When you use your Arcane Recovery feature you can gain 2 additional level of spells.
When you prepare wizard spells using the grimoire as your spellbook, the number of spells you can prepare increases by 2 total.

entries.name: Perfected
entries: legendary (requires attunement by a wizard)
When you use your Arcane Recovery feature you can gain 3 additional level of spells.
When you prepare wizard spells using the grimoire as your spellbook, the number of spells you can prepare increases by 3 total.
If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 15 + your Dexterity modifier.
You gain a +2 to your Wizard Spell {@action Attack} rolls and Spell Save DC.

item.name: Thunder of the Mammoth
entries: When blowing into this horn one creature of your choice can hear a Mammoth bellow, provided the creature is within 600 feet of the horn and not {@condition deafened}. No other creature hears sound coming from the horn.
As an Action you can use the command phrase and blow the horn to create a booming sound and cast the spell Shatter from it [DC13 CON]. Once used this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Amulet of Life Stealing
entries: While wearing this amulet you can use an action to make an unarmed strike using STR or DEX to make the attack roll dealing {@dice 1d4} slashing{@damage  + 4d4} necrotic damage on a hit. Any necrotic damage is transferred to you as healing. Once used this property can't be used again until Midnight.
\columnbreak

item.name: Bracers of the War Mage
item.reqAttune: by a warlock, wizard, or sorcerer
entries: These bracers are made of hardened Dwarven Steel and are imbued with strong defensive magic, to protect the Dwarven War Mages in battle. While wearing these bracers your AC is 14 + DEX.

entries.name: Merchants Luck
entries: When worn (no attunement) the wearer gains advantage on the first persuasion check made every day used in relation to a trade (sale, purchase or barter).

entries.name: Tricksters Pain
entries: When worn (and attuned) the wearer cannot be deceived without being aware of the attempted deceit. The wearer cannot read minds but will immediately know when someone is not being completely truthful and have insight into the degree/scope of the subterfuge in question

entries.name: Spirit Bound
entries: When worn (and attuned) the wearers spirit/soul is bound to the diamond and becomes absorbed by the diamond upon death. When absorbed the spirit remains in the diamond until released. The soul is released when the necklace is worn by another creature and the soul determines that the creature is a suitable host and the soul will then take over the host body and imbue it with all its powers, traits and skills.

item.name: Dwarven Maul of Thunder
entries: This hand sized maul is made of Dwarven Steel inscribed with thunder runes, it hums with a light buzz. It is a martial melee weapon with the light and thrown properties and a range of 30/60. The damage die is {@dice d6}+STR and the type is thunder, after a throw the hammer returns to the thrower's hand.

Once per day on your turn you can speak the command phrase (BY ODINS BEARD) and throw the hammer a a target or unoccupied space, if at a target make an attack roll, any creature within 20 feet of the impact must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 4d6} lightning and {@dice 4d6} thunder as lightning strikes the area and the hammer crashes with a thunderclap. Once used this property can't be used again until the next dawn. In the meantime, the hammer can still be used as a magic weapon.
\pagebreakNum

item.name: Psionic Amplifier
entries: Your Intelligence score is 19 while you are attuned to this item. It has no Effect if your Intelligence is already 19 or higher without it.
It also grants you telepathy (120ft) and glows with a purplish inner light (15 bright/15 dim) while you are attuned to it.
See the introduction of the Monster Manual for rules on how this telepathy works.

entries.name: Winds of Truth
entries: These matching armbands appear to have thin daggers strapped to them. As an action, you can pull up to two magic +1 daggers from the bracers and immediately hurl them, making a ranged attack as the dagger seeks out a target that you can see within 120 feet of you ignoring half and three-quarters cover. A dagger vanishes if you don't hurl it right away, and the daggers disappear right after they hit or miss. The bracer never runs out of daggers.

item.name: Wand of Winter Storms
entries: This wand has 7 charges and is made of translucent crystal resembling a slender icicle. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell ice storm} spell (save DC 17) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 4th-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand melts into water and is destroyed.

entries.name: Swiftness of Sand
entries: The wielder of this Heka, as an action speaks the command phrase "I hate sand. Its coarse, and rough, and irritating. And it gets everywhere." and is magically transformed into a whirlwind of sand, moving up to 60 feet, and reverting to its normal form. While in whirlwind form, the wielder is immune to all damage, and it can't be {@condition grappled}, {@condition petrified}, knocked {@condition prone}, {@condition restrained}, or {@condition stunned}. Equipment worn or carried by the wielder remain in its possession. Once used in such a way it is unable to be used until the next dawn.

item.name: The Devil's Due
entries: This arrow has a icy blue shaft adorned with chardalyn razor fletching and matching head.

entries.name: Levistus' Ire
entries: This arrow adds a {@dice d6} of cold damage along with giving an additional +1 to attack and damage rolls when used to make a ranged attack, returning upon reaching or missing its target. Hitting a target with this arrow makes your next shot against that target have advantage. Upon a critical hit the target is wounded and loses 10 feet of movement speed and 5 feet for each after the first.
\columnbreak

item.name: Amulet of Lathander
entries: Your Constitution score is 19 while you wear this holy symbol. It has no effect on you if your Constitution is already 19 or higher without it. Additionally, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
While you wear this amulet, you can use your Channel Divinity feature without expending one of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Sword of the Elements
entries: This item appears to be a longsword hilt. While grasping the hilt, you can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or make the blade disappear. While the blade exists, this magic longsword has the finesse property. If you are proficient with {@item shortsword|phb|shortswords} or {@item longsword|phb|longswords}, you are proficient with this sword.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals force damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit an elemental with it, that target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage.

item.name: Spelljamming Mythallar
entries: The Spelljamming Mythallar looks like an large crystal ball filled with a swirling miasma resembling Wildspace held in an ornate cradle. The globe draws magic directly from the Weave that can be harnessed for various purposes. The Spelljamming Mythallar is capable of venturing into the multiverse.

The Spelljamming Mythallar is 10 feet in diameter, but controls the area within 500 feet of it. To attune to this mythallar, a creature must finish a short rest within 30 feet of it, meditating on the mythallar, this artifact does not count against your attunement limit. The Spelljamming Mythallar's properties are as follows:

items: While you're within 500 feet of the Spelljamming Mythallar, you can choose which direction and how fast the mythallar moves.  It can move up to Spelljamming Speed (100 million miles in 24 hours) in Wildspace or the Astral Sea, or up to 10 mph while objects weighing 1 ton or more are within 1 mile of it. All matter within 500 feet of the device moves with it. The Spelljamming Mythallar and all structures held aloft by it hover in place when not in motion.

As an action, you can cause one magic item you are holding within 30 feet of the Spelljamming Mythallar to immediately regain all its expended charges or uses. A magic item recharged in this manner can't be recharged by the Spelljamming Mythallar again until after the item regains expended charges or uses on its own.

You can use the Spelljamming Mythallar to cast the {@spell dream of the blue veil|tce} provided you have the material components. The creature limit is lifted and instead uses the area controlled by the mythallar. This property can be used 1 time per day, or after the mythallar has been fueled by a magic item (up to DM Discretion).

Any creature that touches the globe of the mythallar must make a DC 30 Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 30d10 + 100} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Any object that touches the globe, other than some artifacts or the mythallar's cradle, is disintegrated instantly (no save).

entries.name: Transfer Attunement
entries: You can use an action to touch a willing spellcaster. That creature attunes to the spelljamming helm immediately, and your attunement to it ends.

item.name: Belt of Utility
entries: This canvas belt is adorned with many small pouches along the strap, it is able to magically fit any waist and can only be unbuckled by the attuned wearer. When the attuned wearer reaches into a pouch of this belt they are able to pull any Adventuring Gear of their choice worth less than 10gp as their item interaction. The item persists until the belt is used again or the item is not in use, then the item produced disappears.

item.name: Belt of Giant Might
entries: While attuned to this belt, your Strength score changes to 19. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than 19.

You can channel the Ancient Giant's essence as a Bonus Action to gain the benefits of the Enlarge portion of the Enlarge/Reduce spell for 1 minute. Once used this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Adventurer's Guide to Térûvia
entries: The Adventurer's Guide to Térûvia contains the basic knowledge an Adventurer would need to navigate Térûvia. In addition to information the book contains a map with live tracking of the book's location to aid in navigation, along with the forms needed for reports and the means to send them via transport slot on the back of the cover. This handbook, can't be damaged by fire, acid, or immersion in water. In addition, the book doesn't deteriorate with age.

item.name: Adventurers Initiative ID
entries: The Adventurers Initiative ID is keyed to each individual Adventurer and functions as your pass around Térûvia as it is used to reap any of the benefits that come with being and Adventurer like lodging, rations, ammunition, and basic components. It also functions as a coin purse for the keyed Adventurer storing all coin one might encounter and converting between Silver, Gold, and Platinum at will. The ID also lets the Adventurer know when the damage or effect they may be trying to inflict on a target is useful or not calling out Immunities and Resistances along with Vulnerabilities.
